result.execSummary:
The defendant Josue Ayala Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josue Ayala Perez

records.addlTxt: Letter to Defendant re: payment of attorney fees

10:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Josue Ayala Perez in court.  Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court for Josue Ayala Perez. 
Interpreter Maria Marin appears via zoom. 
State moves to amend count 1 to misd.  possession of cocaine 961.41(3g)(e)- Granted. 
Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea - Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. 
Pfeifer/Burns/Court statement to sentencing.
Court WHS and POP For 12 months  - each count CC.
CC/CV -$686.00 from bond - balance held for attorney fees. 
AODA and recovery as recommended. 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
2 days credit if revoked.
Submit DNA sample- The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). 
Appeal rights filed.
Defendant to report to local PD's office after court.

records.addlTxt:
9:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Josue Ayala Perez appeared telephonically. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Josue Ayala Perez. Interpreter Mariana Kralewski appearing by video. Defendant waives preliminary hearing - has offer from DA and is going to accept. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Burns willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Burns statement to next appearance. Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. Bond continued. adj. 09:57 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Josue Ayala Perez appeared in court. Interpreter Laura Salcido Blancas appearing by video. Court reviews case. Defendant has not contacted PD's office - would like to obtain counsel - is employed. Court directs Defendant to meet with member of  PD's office to determine eligibility. Bond continued. adj. 02:40 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Josue Ayala Perez appeared by video, in custody. Interpreter Maria Marin appearing by video. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant statement to charges/employment. Schiek/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj. 02:26 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
